001package squidpony.squidmath;
002
003import squidpony.squidai.astar.DefaultGraph;
004import squidpony.squidai.astar.Heuristic;
005import squidpony.squidai.astar.Pathfinder;
006import squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.DungeonGenerator;
007
008import java.io.Serializable;
009import java.util.ArrayList;
010import java.util.Map;
011
012/**
013 * Performs A* search.
014 *
015 * A* is a best-first search algorithm for pathfinding. It uses a heuristic
016 * value to reduce the total search space. If the heuristic is too large then
017 * the optimal path is not guaranteed to be returned.
018 * <br>
019 * This implementation is a thin wrapper around {@link Pathfinder} and the other code in the
020 * {@code squidpony.squidai.astar} package; it replaces an older, much-less-efficient A* implementation with one based
021 * on GDX-AI's IndexedAStarPathFinder class. The only major change in the API is that this version returns an ArrayList
022 * of Coord instead of a Queue of Coord. Typical usage of this class involves either the simpler technique of only using
023 * {@code '#'} for walls or obstructions and calling {@link #AStarSearch(char[][], SearchType)}, or the more complex
024 * technique that allows variable costs for different types of terrain, using
025 * {@link squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.DungeonUtility#generateAStarCostMap(char[][], Map, double)} to generate a cost
026 * map; if you used the old AStarSearch, then be advised that the default cost is now 1.0 instead of 0.0.
027 * @see squidpony.squidai.astar.Pathfinder the pathfinding class this is based on; Pathfinder can be used independently
028 * @see squidpony.squidai.DijkstraMap a sometimes-faster pathfinding algorithm that can pathfind to multiple goals
029 * @see squidpony.squidai.CustomDijkstraMap an alternative to DijkstraMap; faster and supports complex adjacency rules
030 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
031 * @author Tommy Ettinger - optimized code
032 */
033public class AStarSearch implements Serializable {
034    private static final long serialVersionUID = 10L;
035    /**
036     * The type of heuristic to use.
037     */
038    public enum SearchType {
039
040        /**
041         * The distance it takes when only the four primary directions can be
042         * moved in.
043         */
044        MANHATTAN(DefaultGraph.MANHATTAN),
045        /**
046         * The distance it takes when diagonal movement costs the same as
047         * cardinal movement.
048         */
049        CHEBYSHEV(DefaultGraph.CHEBYSHEV),
050        /**
051         * The distance it takes as the crow flies.
052         */
053        EUCLIDEAN(DefaultGraph.EUCLIDEAN),
054        /**
055         * Full space search. Least efficient but guaranteed to return a path if
056         * one exists. See also {@link squidpony.squidai.DijkstraMap}.
057         */
058        DIJKSTRA(DefaultGraph.DIJKSTRA);
059        Heuristic<Coord> heuristic;
060        SearchType(Heuristic<Coord> heuristic){
061            this.heuristic = heuristic;
062        }
063    }
064
065    protected int width, height;
066    protected Coord start, target;
067    protected SearchType type;
068    
069    protected DefaultGraph graph;
070    protected Pathfinder<Coord> pathfinder;
071    protected ArrayList<Coord> path;
072    
073    
074    protected AStarSearch()
075    {
076        width = 0;
077        height = 0;
078        type = SearchType.MANHATTAN;
079    }
080    /**
081     * Builds a pathing object to run searches on.
082     * <br>
083     * Values in the map are treated as positive values being legal weights, with higher values being harder to pass
084     * through. Any negative value is treated as being an impassible space. A weight of 0 can be moved through at no
085     * cost, but this should be used very carefully, if at all. Cost maps are commonly built using the
086     * {@link squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.DungeonUtility#generateAStarCostMap(char[][], Map, double)} and
087     * {@link  squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.DungeonUtility#generateAStarCostMap(char[][])} methods from a 2D char array.
088     * <br>
089     * If the type is Manhattan, only the cardinal directions will be used. All other search types will return result
090     * based on diagonal and cardinal pathing (8-way).
091     *
092     * @param map the search map, as produced by {@link squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.DungeonUtility#generateAStarCostMap(char[][])}
093     * @param type the manner of search
094     */
095    public AStarSearch(double[][] map, SearchType type) {
096        if (map == null)
097            throw new NullPointerException("map should not be null when building an AStarSearch");
098        width = map.length;
099        height = width == 0 ? 0 : map[0].length;
100        this.type = type == null ? SearchType.EUCLIDEAN : type;         
101        graph = new DefaultGraph(map, (this.type != SearchType.MANHATTAN));
102        pathfinder = new Pathfinder<>(graph, true);
103        path = new ArrayList<>(width + height);
104    }
105    /**
106     * Builds a pathing object to run searches on.
107     * <br>
108     * Values in the map are all considered equally passable unless the char is {@code '#'}, in which case it is
109     * considered an impassable wall. The {@link DungeonGenerator#getBareDungeon()} method is a common way to get a map
110     * where only '#' is used to mean a wall.
111     * <br>
112     * If the type is Manhattan, only the cardinal directions will be used. All other search types will return result
113     * based on diagonal and cardinal pathing (8-way).
114     *
115     * @param map a 2D char array where only {@code '#'} represents a wall, and anything else is equally passable
116     * @param type the manner of search
117     */
118    public AStarSearch(char[][] map, SearchType type) {
119        if (map == null)
120            throw new NullPointerException("map should not be null when building an AStarSearch");
121        width = map.length;
122        height = width == 0 ? 0 : map[0].length;
123        this.type = type == null ? SearchType.EUCLIDEAN : type;
124        graph = new DefaultGraph(map, (this.type != SearchType.MANHATTAN));
125        pathfinder = new Pathfinder<>(graph, true);
126        path = new ArrayList<>(width + height);
127    }
128
129    /**
130     * Resets this pathing object to use a different map and optionally a different SearchType.
131     * <br>
132     * Values in the map are treated as positive values being legal weights, with higher values being harder to pass
133     * through. Any negative value is treated as being an impassible space. A weight of 0 can be moved through at no
134     * cost, but this should be used very carefully, if at all. Cost maps are commonly built using the
135     * {@link squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.DungeonUtility#generateAStarCostMap(char[][], Map, double)} and
136     * {@link  squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.DungeonUtility#generateAStarCostMap(char[][])} methods from a 2D char array.
137     * <br>
138     * If the type is Manhattan, only the cardinal directions will be used. All other search types will return result
139     * based on diagonal and cardinal pathing (8-way).
140     *
141     * @param map the search map, as produced by {@link squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.DungeonUtility#generateAStarCostMap(char[][])}
142     * @param type the manner of search
143     */
144    public AStarSearch reinitialize(double[][] map, SearchType type){
145        if (map == null)
146            throw new NullPointerException("map should not be null when building an AStarSearch");
147        width = map.length;
148        height = width == 0 ? 0 : map[0].length;
149        this.type = type == null ? SearchType.EUCLIDEAN : type;
150        graph.init(map, this.type != SearchType.MANHATTAN);
151        pathfinder = new Pathfinder<>(graph, true);
152        return this;
153    }
154
155    /**
156     * Resets this pathing object to use a different map and optionally a different SearchType.
157     * <br>
158     * Values in the map are all considered equally passable unless the char is {@code '#'}, in which case it is
159     * considered an impassable wall. The {@link DungeonGenerator#getBareDungeon()} method is a common way to get a map
160     * where only '#' is used to mean a wall.
161     * <br>
162     * If the type is Manhattan, only the cardinal directions will be used. All other search types will return result
163     * based on diagonal and cardinal pathing (8-way).
164     *
165     * @param map a 2D char array where only {@code '#'} represents a wall, and anything else is equally passable
166     * @param type the manner of search
167     */
168    public AStarSearch reinitialize(char[][] map, SearchType type){
169        if (map == null)
170            throw new NullPointerException("map should not be null when building an AStarSearch");
171        width = map.length;
172        height = width == 0 ? 0 : map[0].length;
173        this.type = type == null ? SearchType.EUCLIDEAN : type;
174        graph.init(map, this.type != SearchType.MANHATTAN);
175        pathfinder = new Pathfinder<>(graph, true);
176        return this;
177    }
178
179    /**
180     * Finds an A* path to the target from the start. If no path is possible,
181     * returns null.
182     *
183     * @param startx the x coordinate of the start location
184     * @param starty the y coordinate of the start location
185     * @param targetx the x coordinate of the target location
186     * @param targety the y coordinate of the target location
187     * @return the shortest path, or null if no path is possible
188     */
189    public ArrayList<Coord> path(int startx, int starty, int targetx, int targety) {
190        return path(Coord.get(startx, starty), Coord.get(targetx, targety));
191    }
192    /**
193     * Finds an A* path to the target from the start. If no path is possible,
194     * returns null.
195     *
196     * @param start the start location
197     * @param target the target location
198     * @return the shortest path, or null if no path is possible
199     */
200    public ArrayList<Coord> path(Coord start, Coord target) {
201        path.clear();
202        this.start = start;
203        this.target = target;
204        if(pathfinder.searchNodePath(start, target, type.heuristic, path)) 
205            return path;
206        else
207            return null;
208    }
209
210        public int getWidth() {
211                return width;
212        }
213
214        public int getHeight() {
215                return height;
216        }
217
218        @Override
219        public String toString() {
220        int cellSize = (int)Math.log10(Math.round(pathfinder.metrics.maxCost)) + 2;
221        StringBuilder result = new StringBuilder((width * cellSize + 1) * height);
222        graph.show(result, pathfinder, pathfinder.metrics);
223        for (int i = 0; i + 1 < cellSize; i++) {
224            result.setCharAt((width * cellSize + 1) * start.y + cellSize * start.x + i, '@');
225            result.setCharAt((width * cellSize + 1) * target.y + cellSize * target.x + i, '!');
226        }
227        return result.toString();
228    }
229}
